result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jiovanny Leon-Villanueva

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Justin G Griffis
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:57 AM Defendant Jiovanny Leon-Villanueva in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  The defendant states he contacted the Public Defenders Office ten days ago and he was approved for counsel then.  The Court will set this matter for a preliminary hearing date and conducts colloquy with the defendant in regards to time limits.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived by defendant.  Court informs defendant to contact the Public Defenders office to ensure counsel is being appointed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:32 AM Defendant Jiovanny Leon-Villanueva appeared by Zoom.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant states he was not able to retain counsel.
Court advises of right to an attorney.
The Court orders the Defendant to contact SPD right after court.
The Court orders the Defendant to APPEAR IN PERSON at the next court date.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
